meta.name: Lecture Note Rewrite
meta.description: Rewrite lecture notes to follow the CLAUDE.md style guide
notes: NO column-margin blocks - remove or inline all ::: {.column-margin} content
Narrative format - write in flowing prose, not lists
Short paragraphs - 2-4 sentences max, break up long blocks
Be concise and clear - no fluff, get to the point
Appeal to intuition - explain the 'why' before the 'how'
No em-dashes (---) - use periods to split sentences, or commas/parentheses for clauses
Direct opening statements - start sections with 'Let's talk about X' or 'The key idea is...'
Transitional questions - guide reader logic with 'Why does this matter?' or 'What happens when...?'
Insert empty line before bullet points when bullets are necessary
Figures come before explanations with immediate commentary after the code block
Center all figures with fig-cap and label
IMPORTANT: Use proper Quarto figure syntax - see figureSyntax below for details
Keep code minimal - hide non-essential code, show only main concepts (see codeVisibility below)
writingPatterns: Hook with weirdness: When introducing concept X, first show how strange/counterintuitive X is with concrete examples, then reveal why X is crucial. This twist grabs attention.
Open with engaging questions or historical/cultural hooks to draw readers in
Use direct address naturally (Let's talk about..., Put on a math hat..., Have you ever wondered...)
Embed questions to guide reader thinking (But how do we solve this? Which one should we choose?)
Walk through math step by step, explaining each transformation
Connect abstract concepts to practical applications and real-world examples
Reference related ideas from other modules or prior knowledge
Keep explanations flowing naturally, not formulaic
meta.learningGoalsTemplate:
::: {.callout-note title="What you'll learn in this module"}
This module introduces [core concept].

You'll learn:

- What **[concept A]** means and how to [apply it].
- How to **[skill B]** so [benefit].
- The [counterintuitive insight C] and the notion of **[related concept]**.
- Practical consequences for [application area].
:::

features.description: Rewrite a lecture note file to follow CLAUDE.md style guide: docs/lecture-note/m05-images/overview.qmd
steps: Read the current content of the file
Add a callout-note with learning goals at the start if missing
Convert content to narrative format with short paragraphs (2-4 sentences)
Replace em-dashes (---) with periods, commas, or parentheses
Use conversational tone with direct address (Let's talk about..., Shift your attention...)
Remove all ::: {.column-margin} blocks - inline the content or remove if not essential
Use ::: {.callout-tip title="Try it yourself"} for exercises
Ensure visuals-first approach: figures before explanations
Walk through math derivations step by step when they offer insight
Git add, commit, and push the changes
